description:
**Fix Overview**:

To resolve the elevation of privilege vulnerability identified as CVE-2023-36003, it is essential to apply the necessary updates provided by Microsoft.

1. Identify your Windows version and build number from the list below:
   - Windows 11 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.17763.5206, 10.0.20348.2159, 10.0.25398.584, 10.0.14393.6529
   - Windows 11 Version 23H2 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.22631.2861
   - Windows 11 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.22621.2861
   - Windows 11 Version 21H2 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.22000.2652
   - Windows 10 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.17763.5206, 10.0.10240.20345, 10.0.14393.6529
   - Windows 10 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.19045.3803

2. Download and install the relevant updates from the Microsoft Update Catalog using these links:
   - [KB5033371](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033371)
   - [KB5033118](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033118)
   - [KB5033375](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033375)
   - [KB5033372](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033372)
   - [KB5033379](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033379)
   - [KB5033369](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033369)
   - [KB5033383](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033383)
   - [KB5033373](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033373)

**Details**:
- These updates address the vulnerabilities that may grant unauthorized elevation of privileges to local attackers. Always ensure your system is backed up prior to installation to prevent data loss.

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure to verify the compatibility of your Windows version.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the updates.
